_header: King of grace and full of pity / Lord of Heaven I-blessed thou be
Note: MSS without the invocation formerly listed as 1309 (see numbers 2-3 below); cf. also 4797.
_description: The Fifteen Signs before the Day of Judgment, prefaced by a short invocation of nine couplets

BodAsh1416.First Lines:
Kynge of grace & full of pittieLord of heuyn blessed thou
                    be…
BodAsh1416.Last Lines:
…then all that byn a lyueshall then to duste be
                    dryue

BodAddE6.First Lines:
XV tokenes tellin y mayXV dayis be forin domis dayAlso him
                    seyez þe profecieAftir þe wordis of ieromie…
BodAddE6.Last Lines:
…Wanne we habbin nede & nouþe þou vs bringe out
                    of þe deuelis mouþe

BodDig86.First Lines:
Fiftene toknen ich tellen mayOf xv dayes er
                    domesdai…
BodDig86.Last Lines:
…Ihesu crist ȝe þat we motenAr we bended of oure
                    sunnen debote
BodDig86.Note: 70 lines of text are lost with the outer half of f. 121.
BodDig86.Facsimiles:
Tschann,  Judith A.,  and  Malcolm B. Parkes.  
             “Introduction.” 
             Facsimile of Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS Digby 86
EETS
         s.s. 16 (1996).
BodDig86.Editions:
Stengel,  Edmund. 
             Coducem Manu Scriptum Digby 86….
         Halle: Orphanotrophei, 1871: 53-7.

BodTan407.First Lines:
…The xite day schal come þounder lythWith
                    stormys grete & strong flyth…
BodTan407.Last Lines:
…Whan body & soule schal parte a tooCrist vs graunt
                    þat it be soo
BodTan407.Note:
Begins imperfectly at top of folio, Day XI to Day XV only. Also foliated
                    pages 87-92. Hamer (1995)
XHamer,  Richard. 
             A Manuscript Index to the Index of Middle English Verse.
         London: British Library, 1995 lists as ‘Reference wrong’,
                    since bad key lists as Tanner 412 (SC 10239).

CamTCC263.First Lines:
Kynge of grace & ful of pyteLord of heuyn I blyssyd þou
                    be…
CamTCC263.Last Lines:
…And grawnt vs thatt hytt so beAmen Amen lord ffor
                    charite
CamTCC263.Note:
35 couplets, including 4 couplet invocation and two incomplete couplets
                    of one line each.
CamTCC263.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             Hymns to the Virgin and Christ…and other religious poems.
EETS
         o.s. 24 (1867); repr. 1973: 118-25.

BlCottCalAII.First Lines:
Kyng of heuen blessed þu beLorde of grace & of
                    pyte…
BlCottCalAII.Last Lines:
…When we haue done here our endeTo þy Ryche blysse
                    þat we mowe wende
BlCottCalAII.Note:
Treated as continuation of 436,
                    with only a small paraph mark to left of first line; arabic numbers to left of
                    first line for each of the 15 days; large centered and yellow-washed ‘Amen
                    for charite’ after last line, f. 91rb.
BlCottCalAII.Editions:
Varnhagen,  Hermann. 
             “Zu mittelenglischen gedichten: IV-X.” 
             Anglia
         3 (1880): 59-67, 275-92, 415-25, 533-51: 544-51.

YaleBei365.First Lines:
Kyng of blysse blyssyd þu belord of myth and of
                    pete…
YaleBei365.Last Lines:
…ffader the sonne and the holy gostekyng and lord thow arte
                    moste
YaleBei365.Editions:
Smith,  Lucy Toulmin,
                        ed.  
             A Commonplace Book of the Fifteenth Century.
         Norwich: Kerrison, Goose, 1886: 71-9.
